features: MADE TO TRAVEL: Hot-2-Trot Travel Iron 800 watt, dual voltage (120V/240V) for local or international travel. Lightweight and portable at 1.2 pounds. Travel bag included.
POWERFUL SHOT OF STEAM FEATURE: works horizontally or vertically for hanging garments, upholstery or drapery
EASY-TO-USE: soft touch ergonomic handle keeps controls at your fingertips with an 8-foot cord to easily access outlets
NON-STICK SOLEPLATE: nonstick soleplate to easily glide over fabrics
FABRIC SELECT: control dial offers the right heat for different fabrics including linen, cotton, silk, wool and more
EASY TO MANEUVER: 8-foot cord allows for freedom of movement while ironing
body.description: Sunbeam Hot-2-Trot 800W Travel Iron is a compact, lightweight iron ideal for your next vacation or business travel. The 120/240V dual voltage system is convenient for local or international travel. This iron offers a powerful Shot of Steam feature that functions both horizontally and vertically for hanging clothes. This quick heating mini iron boasts a range of temperatures for a multitude of fabrics and ideal for crafting and quilting projects. Featuring a soft touch handle and accents that offer the utmost comfort while on-the-go or at home.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful product - Horrible shipping Experience
reviews.reviewText: Sunbeam Hot 2 Trot Travel IronI actually bought this little iron in spite of already having a full-sized iron as well. I quilt, and have a small ironing board set up on a side table next to my sewing machine, and didn't want too big of a draw on the same circuit as my sewing machine. The 800 watts helps me avoid that.I've only had this item in my home for three days, but out of the box, this little work horse was absolutely great. Filling it was different than other irons I've used, but very easy. It heats well, steams well, and all the material I've pressed with it looks great. I'm very happy with the results, and would recommend it to anyone. Nice long 8-foot cord, weight of under 1-1/4 pounds, and the sole plate is not oversized, so I didn't burn my forearm as I reached for something on the ironing board (yes, I've done that in the past). As a travel iron, it has a switch so you can use it for either 120V or 240V, which means it can be used internationally. With the light weight, you really *could* travel with this iron. I can unreservedly recommend this product.Shipping of this Product: I ordered the iron, and it was due to arrive the very next day. Unfortunately, they sent me PPE (the full regalia - acrylic face shields with foam brow seals)(!) I am still mystified as to how someone could confuse the two items, but I don't work in a warehouse, so I'm willing to give them the benefit of the doubt. Obviously, I had to return it and ask them to send me the iron. Which I did, and then it was three days of receiving the dreaded "we're so sorry your order has been delayed" message, only to be able to track with UPS that it was not sent when they claimed it was. Not the finest part of the transaction, to say the least. It left me very disappointed and irritated.So, to recap: Travel Iron - Five Stars. Shipping Experience - Negative Points. For what it's worth.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I bought this iron to take on a trip to Israel. It worked like a charm. The quality is great. It has several settings which include steam and spray. You have to make sure to get all the water out before you lay it down or it will leak. however, that’s the way a lot of irons are. It does not have an automatic shut off, but for less than $20 it is great value for your money. I will be taking this whenever I go traveling. If you’re on the fence, get it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good iron, annoying for a leftie
reviews.reviewText: This iron is nicely compact and gets hot quickly. I use it for quilting projects. There is one annoyance, though. The cord is attached on the side of the iron instead of the back. As a result, it only naturally falls to the back of the table when used in your right hand. If used in the left hand, the cord wraps around the front and becomes a bit of a hazard for melting and just an annoyance. The only way around it is to use it "backwards" with the flat end of the iron to the forward direction and the pointy end to the back.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super awesome iron
reviews.reviewText: This iron is so cool. It operates on dual voltage. I often go to Europe and this was so helpful for me. Super life saver. Also it worked very well in UK. This do get super hot if you forget to turn it off, it may burn the cloth. Be aware of that.It clears out tough wrinkles also (like cotton fabrics).I simply love the quality of dual voltage and its very light weight.You can carry this in your carry-on (also in luggage too). Its TSA approved. I always take it in my carry-on because of its light weight.100% recommended item for all travelers ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sunbeam Hot-2-Trot Steam Iron
reviews.reviewText: I bought this little iron specifically for crafting. I absolutely love it! It heats to needed temp in just seconds, it's lightweight and the perfect size for storage in small spaces. It takes about 30-45 minutes to cool enough to store. Haven't used the steam function yet. Highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love this I am I bought it for vacation and it worked well. I use it almost every day for the days I was in London picked up hardly any space I’m very light to carry in luggage and it delivered it ironed well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars 5 stars for customer service - Ok Iron, Poor Craftsmanship - I received one with a hole in the blue plastic on top left handle!
reviews.reviewText: Updated review (3/3/2016)Ok, so I wrote to the customer service requesting a replacement with a non-defective piece or a return (in which case I was planning to buy a new piece). They have arranged to send me a replacement via overnight shipping. Response was fast! Good Job Customer ServicePrevious review (3/2/2016)Just tested the new Sunbeam Hot-2-Trot 800 Watt Compact Travel Iron. Positives: It is really small and compact-perfect size and weight for travel. For its size, it does a reasonable good job of ironing/ removing creases - I tested it on a thin fabric. As long as you do not expect the same results that a larger professional iron would give, you should be happy. Now the negatives: You get what you pay for - It is rather cheaply made. Mine had rough edges visible near the light and came with a small hole (!!) in the blue rubber on top left hand side. There seemed to be some stains on the bottom (soleplate) - not sure if it was due to improper packing or if I was sent a used product. Next, when the iron heats up in the steam mode, it spits water. Overall: Not a great product, but not bad either. It would help if the indicator light did a better job with indicating that the iron is still on (it switches off after a few minutes and there is no way to tell if the iron is on or off-this can be dangerous especially if one forgets to unplug it!). The iron does get a little hot when it is set to the maximum setting. Finally, I wish they would check the pieces before packaging because I bought it to on the request of someone overseas who travels a LOT. I was requested to buy it and test it before bringing it to them, which I just did. I am supposed to bring it for them when I travel to their country in 10 days, but I am a little embarrassed because of the poor craftsmanship of this piece they have sent! I will try to replace with a new one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My New Favorite Iron
reviews.reviewText: I am a quilter, and this is my new favorite iron. It's small, easy to grab and gets plenty hot. It also heats up quickly. I have two other large irons, but this is my new go to iron.

reviews.reviewTitle: Súper práctica, no sólo para viaje
reviews.reviewText: Me encanta su tamaño y peso… es sólida y a la vez ligera y plancha de maravilla!!’n
Great for travel, strong enough to get the job done. I like the fact I can use vertically or on a flat surface, depending on what I need.

I've wanted a 'little' iron for years to press small features on clothing (e.g., collars, cuffs), and quick touch-ups. Iron is ergonomically designed to feel very comfortable guiding it. This iron easily holds 100 ml of water (3.25 oz) - I found a small plastic funnel makes it easier to fill the reservoir. Burst of steam function works great. I doubt I'd take it in my luggage when I travel as I travel light. Iron has 240V + 120V switch so it will work in other countries.One warning - the iron heats up very quickly, so place iron in upright position before plugging in.

Muy buena compra y a buen precio. Además es pequeña y cabe en cualquier lugar. Genera una buena temperatura y tiene dos niveles de temperatura más un pequeño apartado para poner agua y que salga en forma de vapor.

Got the product after 3 weeks. Didn't end up using it till 2 weeks later only to find out that the product didnt work. And i missed the deadline of 10 days to return it so they won't issue me a refund now.
